channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: I’m 63 and planning to retire. I watched in horror as the markets tanked. Will I have enough to get me to my 90s?

item.title: Oil tilts higher after latest supply data, Russia’s pause on energy-infrastructure attacks
item.description: Oil futures inched higher Wednesday, giving up early losses after official U.S. data revealed weekly declines in petroleum-product stockpiles along wi...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Should 401(k) investors follow the advice of top fund managers?
‘I’m absolutely terrible at managing money’: I’m 35 with zero savings and $8,000 debt. How do I turn my life around?
item.description: “I want to get into a financial position where I’ve got decent retirement savings.”

item.title: Some home buyers are hoping for a recession to bring down housing prices. Are they right?
item.description: More than a third of Americans said they want the housing market to crash because they think it would lower home prices and property taxes.
